articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Another child died of malnutrition in northern Gaza overnight and six people were killed and several wounded in renewed Israeli bombing of residential areas of Gaza City, Palestinian health officials said on Thursday.
articles.title: Girl dies of malnutrition in Gaza as Israel bombs north and south

articles.author: Helen Coster, James Oliphant, Joseph Ax
articles.description: Democratic President Joe Biden and his Republican rival Donald Trump take the stage on Thursday night for a debate that will offer voters a rare side-by-side look at the two oldest candidates ever to seek the U.S. presidency.
articles.title: Biden and Trump face off in early debate, with age, ability in focus

articles.author: Ahmed Elimam, Laila Bassam, Tom Perry
articles.description: Satellite images showing much of the Lebanese village of Aita al-Shaab in ruins after months of Israeli air strikes offer a glimpse of the scale of damage in one of Hezbollah's main bastions in south Lebanon.
articles.title: Israel's bombs flatten swaths of Lebanon village amid fears of wider war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: About a dozen Bolivian military officers have been arrested following Wednesday's attempted coup, a senior government minister told local television on Thursday, adding they face accusations that could lead to 15 to 30-year prison terms.
articles.title: Military officers detained in Bolivia after attempted coup, minister says

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iranians will vote for a new president on Friday following Ebrahim Raisi's death in a helicopter crash, choosing from a tightly controlled group of four candidates loyal to the supreme leader, at a time of growing public frustration.
articles.title: Iran holds presidential vote with limited choices

articles.author: Andrew Gray, Thomas Escritt
articles.description: European Union leaders agreed to nominate Ursula von der Leyen of Germany for a second five-year term as president of the European Commission, the EU's powerful executive body.
articles.title: EU leaders pick von der Leyen for second term as Commission chief

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's military said on Thursday its forces had forced Russian troops out of a district in the town of Chasiv Yar on the war's eastern front seen as Moscow's next target in its slow advance through the area.
articles.title: Ukraine military says Russian troops pushed out of part of key eastern town

articles.author: Aaron Ross
articles.description: Kenyan police put up roadblocks on streets leading to the presidential palace on Thursday as some protesters vowed to "occupy State House" despite the president's climbdown on proposed tax hikes that sparked a week of demonstrations.
articles.title: Kenya braces for fresh protests despite president's tax climbdown

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: French Prime Minister Gabriel Attal on Thursday accused his main challenger for the top job, Jordan Bardella, of tolerating racist speech in the ranks of his far-right camp amid a heated last television debate before the start of parliamentary elections.
articles.title: French party leaders hold heated last election debate

articles.author: Gloria Dickie
articles.description: The number of days reaching a sizzling 35 degrees Celsius (95 Fahrenheit) in 20 of the world's largest capitals - from Delhi to Jakarta to Buenos Aires - has risen 52% over the past three decades, a think tank analysis found on Friday.
articles.title: Number of days over 35 C surges in world's scorching capitals
